name: gams-ide
description: A GAMS integrated development environment for VSCode

commands.title: GAMS: Set as main GAMS file
GAMS: Add to exclude from main GAMS file list
GAMS: Remove from exclude from main GAMS file list

gamsIde.gamsExecutable.description: Path to GAMS executable, will default to PATH or common install directories.

gamsIde.scratchDirectory.description: The (scratch) directory where gams-ide will read/write temp files. Ideally located on a fast internal disk.

gamsIde.keepOutputFilesInScratchDir.description: Keep generated .err, .ref, and .lst files in the scratch directory instead of deleting them after use.

gamsIde.runDiagnosticsOnSave.description: Compile the model when saving any file in the workspace. This is necessary to show diagnostics (e.g. errors) in the editor.

gamsIde.skipDiagnosticsOnFileOpen.description: Do not update diagnostics (GAMS compilation check) when opening new files. Enable this if you want to manually trigger diagnostics.

gamsIde.enableModelIncludeTreeView.description: Enable a tree view of all includes/batincludes of the model in the sidebar. Make sure that the 'Include File Summary' is printed to the listing file, and $offInclude isn't present in the model source.

gamsIde.maxErrorsToDisplay.description: Maximum amount of errors that will be highlighted by gams-ide. Put a 0 if no maximum should be defined. Keep in mind that often only the first error is an actual GAMS error, while the subsequent errors may result from the first error.

gamsIde.showCompilationNotifications.description: Notify when GAMS encountered system issues (e.g. missing .opt files) during compilation.

gamsIde.jumpToFirstError.description: Automatically scroll to the first error in the listing file when compilation errors are encountered.

gamsIde.jumpToAbort.description: If found, automatically scroll to the first abort parameter found in the listing file.

gamsIde.autoUnfoldListingEntriesTreshold.description: Automatically unfold listing entries (e.g. Displays) if their amount does not exceed the following value.

gamsIde.onlyAutoUnfoldDisplayStatements.description: Limit 'Auto unfold listing entries treshold' to display statements. Other listing entries will not be unfolded automatically.

gamsIde.defaultParameterToJumpToAfterSol.description: If found, the listing will be auto-scrolled to the following display paramter.

gamsIde.autoScrollToEndOfListing.description: Automatically scroll to the end of the listing after a solve.

gamsIde.mainGmsFile.description: Main GAMS file to execute if your model consists of multiple files. This file will be executed when you press the 'Run' button, and compiled when saving any file in your workspace. Common main GMS files are 'exp_starter.gms' (FarmDyn), 'capmod.gms' (CAPRI), and 'com_.gms' (CGEBOX).

gamsIde.excludeFromMainGmsFile.description: Ignore the 'main GAMS file' setting for these files and folders. This is useful if you have a file or folders that are only used for data generation, but not for the actual model. Note: Only relative and absolute paths without glob characters are supported. Relative paths are relative to the (first) workspace root.

gamsIde.commandLineArguments_compilation.description: Additional command line arguments to pass to GAMS during compilation.

gamsIde.commandLineArguments_execution.description: Additional command line arguments to pass to GAMS during execution.

gamsIde.parseGamsData.description: Show values of sets parameters, as well as the variable and equation listing for each solve in a console panel in the bottom dock. This will execute your model with a resource limit of 0, meaning the solver will terminate after 0 second. Still, this may take a while for large models.

gamsIde.parseGamsDataWithDiagnostics.description: If parseGamsData is enabled, this option will update the GAMS data every time the diagnostics are updated (model compilation). If runDiagnosticsOnSave is enabled, this means your model is executed every time a document is saved.

gamsIde.parseGamsDataResLim.description: Resource limit (resLim) setting when executing the model in order to parse GAMS data values. Defaults to 0.

gamsIde.consoleLimrow.description: LIMROW setting if parse symbol values is turned on

gamsIde.consoleLimcol.description: LIMCOL setting if parse symbol values is turned on

gamsIde.consoleDispWidth.description: dispWidth setting if parse symbol values is turned on

gamsIde.mcpServerPort.description: Port number for the GAMS MCP server. The MCP server provides tools for AI assistants to interact with GAMS models.

languageModelTools.name: gams-ide_search_symbols
languageModelTools.userDescription: Semantically search for GAMS symbols based on a natural language query.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Semantically search for GAMS symbols (sets, parameters, variables, equations) based on a natural language query. Use this to find relevant symbols when you don't know the exact name. Returns a list of symbol names that best match the query.

query.description: The natural language query to find symbols for.

languageModelTools.name: gams-ide_get_symbol_details
languageModelTools.userDescription: Get detailed information about specific GAMS symbols.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Retrieve detailed static analysis information for specific GAMS symbols, including type, description, domain, declaration/definition/control locations, AND all references/assignments (read/write usages). Use this when you need to understand a symbol's structure, where it's defined, and how it's used.

symbols.description: List of symbol names to fetch info for (case insensitive).

languageModelTools.name: gams-ide_get_symbol_values
languageModelTools.userDescription: Get actual data values for GAMS symbols from the latest execution.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Retrieve the actual data values for specific GAMS symbols from the latest execution results. Use this when you need to see the current values of sets, parameters, variables, or equations after a model run.

symbols.description: List of symbol names to fetch data for (case sensitive, matching the data store).

languageModelTools.name: gams-ide_get_model_structure
languageModelTools.userDescription: Get the hierarchy of included files for the main GAMS file.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Get the hierarchy of included files (the 'include tree') for the main GAMS file. Use this to understand file dependencies, execution order, and how different GAMS files are connected.

languageModelTools.name: gams-ide_get_solve_status
languageModelTools.userDescription: Get the Model Status and Solver Status from a listing file.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Get the Model Status and Solver Status from the listing file (e.g. Optimal, Infeasible). Use this to quickly check if the model solved successfully and understand any solver issues.

languageModelTools.name: gams-ide_get_reference_tree
languageModelTools.userDescription: Get the full symbol reference tree as CSV.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Get the full symbol reference tree as CSV. WARNING: This can be very large. Prefer using 'search_gams_symbols' or 'get_symbol_details' unless you need a global view of all symbols in the model.

languageModelTools.name: gams-ide_check_syntax_errors
languageModelTools.userDescription: Trigger a syntax check and update diagnostics for the current GAMS file.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Trigger a syntax check and update diagnostics for the current GAMS file or workspace. Use this to validate code changes and find compilation errors before running the model.

file.description: Optional path to a GAMS file to run diagnostics for. If omitted, diagnostics run for the active editor.

languageModelTools.name: gams-ide_get_execution_command
languageModelTools.userDescription: Get the command line string required to execute a GAMS model.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Get the command line string required to execute a GAMS model, including all configured arguments and paths. Use the returned command string with the runInTerminal tool to execute the model and see the log output.

file.description: Optional path to a GAMS file. If omitted, uses gamsIde.mainGmsFile.

extraArgs.description: Optional additional command line arguments to append to the GAMS command.

languageModelTools.name: gams-ide_get_compile_command
languageModelTools.userDescription: Get the command line string required to compile a GAMS model.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Get the command line string required to compile a GAMS model (syntax check only, no execution). Does not execute the command.

file.description: Optional path to a GAMS file. If omitted, uses gamsIde.mainGmsFile.

extraArgs.description: Optional additional command line arguments to append to the GAMS command.

languageModelTools.name: gams-ide_read_listing_for_symbols
languageModelTools.userDescription: Extract specific symbol information from a GAMS listing file.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Read and extract specific symbol information (values, equation listings, solution reports) from a GAMS listing (.lst) file. Use this to debug generated algebra, check results, or understand how equations were generated.

lstFilePath.description: Absolute path to the .lst file to filter.

symbols.description: List of symbol names to filter for.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
